meaningMnemonic:
You learned that 抜ける is "to fall out." If an <kanji>interval of time</kanji> falls out of you, you're totally spaced out. You won't learn anything and you'll become an <vocabulary>idiot</vocabulary>.

間抜け can refer to both a person who does something foolish and to the foolish actions themselves. It's often used to criticize <vocabulary>dumb</vocabulary> behavior.
readingMnemonic: The readings come from the ま reading of 間 and from 抜く.
